meanings.definition: Frilleries: unnecessary or excessive ornamentation or decoration
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with frilleries like fancy curtains and golden frames.
meanings.sent2: She loved to add frilleries to her outfits, such as sparkly jewelry and colorful scarves.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations were so full of frilleries that it looked like a fairy tale setting.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was full of frilleries, making it hard to distinguish the important points.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a sea of frilleries, with flowers of every color and shape imaginable.

meanings.definition: Frilleries: frivolous or extravagant details or accessories
meanings.sent1: The dress was adorned with unnecessary frilleries like bows and ribbons.
meanings.sent2: He always carried around his briefcase filled with frilleries like fancy pens and a mini mirror.
meanings.sent3: The cake was covered in frilleries, making it look more like a work of art than a dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was filled with frilleries, distracting the audience from the main message.
meanings.sent5: The room was a museum of frilleries, with each item more extravagant than the last.
